summary: This is a civil complaint filed in the Southern District of New York by an anonymous plaintiff (Jane Doe) against the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate and Ghislaine Maxwell. The plaintiff alleges she was sexually trafficked and abused by Epstein and Maxwell beginning at age 16. The complaint details the structure of the alleged sex trafficking enterprise, the 2008 plea deal, Epstein's 2019 arrest and death, and specific allegations of abuse against the plaintiff in New York and New Mexico. This is a civil complaint filed by a plaintiff (referred to as 'S' or 'M') against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, alleging sexual assault, battery, false imprisonment, and intentional infliction of emotional distress. The document details specific incidents of abuse at Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico and Les Wexner's estate in Ohio, and describes the plaintiff's unsuccessful attempts to report the crimes to the NYPD, FBI, and media.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.role: Executor of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Named as a defendant in his capacity as an executor of Epstein's estate. Filed affidavits and a Certificate of Trust related to the estate.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.role: Executor of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Named as a defendant in his capacity as an executor of Epstein's estate. Filed affidavits and a Certificate of Trust related to the estate.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Alleged co-conspirator and manager of sex trafficking network
persons.context: Named as a defendant. Alleged to have spent years overseeing and managing Epstein's sex trafficking network, actively recruiting underage girls, and participating in the abuse of the plaintiff.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The deceased central figure of the case. Described as the organizer of a transcontinental sex trafficking network that abused hundreds of young girls. His estate is a defendant.

persons.name: Kenneth Marra
persons.context: Cited for his judicial findings in a prior case that Epstein sexually abused more than 30 minor girls between 1999 and 2007.

persons.name: Amber Sutherland
persons.context: Author of a 2011 New York Post article quoting Epstein making light of his criminal conviction.

persons.name: James B. Stewart
persons.context: Author of a 2019 New York Times article quoting Epstein as saying criminalizing sex with teenage girls was a cultural aberration.

persons.name: Richard Berman
persons.context: Formally dismissed the SDNY indictment against Epstein following his death.

persons.name: Martel Colon Miro
persons.context: One of the witnesses to Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, executed in the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Gulnora Tali
persons.context: One of the witnesses to Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, executed in the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Alleged perpetrator of sexual assault and battery against the plaintiff at his New Mexico ranch and at Les Wexner's Ohio estate. Described as having great power, wealth, and connections.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Owner of the Ohio estate where Epstein had a guest house. The plaintiff was lured there for an 'artist in residence' position and was assaulted. His security personnel allegedly prevented her from leaving.

persons.name: Joshua I. Schiller
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP who signed the complaint on behalf of the plaintiff.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP listed on the complaint.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP listed on the complaint, with pro hac vice status pending.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired for years to operate a sex trafficking network. Maxwell is described as overseeing and managing the network, recruiting girls, and participating in abuse.
Indyke is an appointed executor of Epstein's estate, responsible for administering its assets.
Kahn is an appointed executor of Epstein's estate, responsible for administering its assets.
Maxwell is alleged to have recruited the plaintiff under false pretenses, pressured her into massaging Epstein, and sexually assaulted her at Epstein's New Mexico ranch.
Epstein is alleged to have groomed and sexually abused the plaintiff beginning when she was 16 years old, in both New York and New Mexico.
Acted together to recruit, transport, confine, and sexually assault the plaintiff. Maxwell threatened the plaintiff on Epstein's behalf.
Epstein owned a guest house on Wexner's Ohio estate and used it as a location to lure and assault the plaintiff.
Maxwell was present with Epstein at Wexner's estate where the assault occurred.
Epstein is accused of sexually assaulting and battering the plaintiff, and falsely imprisoning her at his New Mexico ranch.
Maxwell is accused of sexually assaulting the plaintiff alongside Epstein and later threatening her to silence her.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Plea Deal
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to a single Florida state charge of procuring a minor for prostitution and entered into a non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida. He served one year in jail with work release privileges.

events.title: New York Post Interview
events.description: Epstein gave an interview to the New York Post after his release, making light of his conviction by saying, "I am not a sexual predator, I'm an offender... It's the difference between a murderer and a person who steals a bagel."

events.title: SDNY Indictment of Epstein
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York charged Epstein with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to the SDNY's sealed indictment.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Epstein executed his last will and testament at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Dismissal of Criminal Case
events.description: U.S. District Judge Richard Berman formally dismissed the SDNY indictment against Epstein following his death.

events.title: Abuse of Plaintiff in New Mexico
events.description: The plaintiff, then a minor, was flown to Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico under false pretenses. There, she was subjected to grooming, unwanted touching by Epstein, and sexual assault by Maxwell.

events.title: Assault at Zorro Ranch
events.description: The plaintiff, aged 16, was taken to Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico, where she was isolated. Epstein entered her room, got into bed, and pressed his body against her without consent. She was unable to escape.

events.title: Assault at Wexner's Ohio Estate
events.description: The plaintiff was lured to billionaire Les Wexner's Ohio estate for an 'artist in residence' position. There, Epstein and Maxwell both sexually assaulted her. Wexner's security personnel prevented her from leaving the estate.

events.title: Maxwell's Threat
events.description: After the assault in Ohio, Maxwell called the plaintiff on behalf of Epstein and threatened to burn all her art and destroy her career to keep her quiet.

events.title: Report to NYPD and FBI
events.description: The plaintiff reported her assault to the NYPD's Sixth Precinct, which referred her to the FBI. She called the FBI to make a report, but authorities ignored her complaint.

events.title: Termination of Criminal Action Against Epstein
events.description: A criminal action against Jeffrey Epstein related to the same sex trafficking enterprise was terminated, which is cited to support the timeliness of this civil complaint under New York law.

events.title: Filing of Civil Complaint
events.description: This civil complaint was filed in court, alleging battery, false imprisonment, and intentional infliction of emotional distress against Epstein and Maxwell.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York 10021 (Epstein's New York mansion)
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico 87056 (Epstein's New Mexico ranch)
United States Virgin Islands (Epstein's domicile at death)
Great St. James Island (Epstein's private island)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (where Epstein was held and died)
Superior Court of the Virgin Islands (where Epstein's estate was probated)
keyFacts: The plaintiff alleges she was sexually trafficked and abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell beginning when she was 16 years old.
The complaint describes a widespread, organized sex trafficking network operated by Epstein and Maxwell that spanned multiple residences and countries, allegedly involving hundreds of young girls.
Epstein's 2008 non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with Florida prosecutors is cited as allowing him to escape proportionate punishment and continue his enterprise.
Specific allegations detail how the plaintiff was recruited under false pretenses of educational help and then abused in New York and at Epstein's remote Zorro Ranch in New Mexico in 1996.
The complaint is filed under the New York Child Victims Act, which extends the statute of limitations for child sexual abuse cases.
The plaintiff alleges she was sexually assaulted by both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell as a 16-year-old at Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico and at Les Wexner's estate in Ohio.
The plaintiff was falsely imprisoned at the remote Zorro Ranch, with no means of communication or transportation to escape.
After an assault in Ohio, Ghislaine Maxwell threatened the plaintiff, saying 'We're going to burn all your art' to silence her.

The plaintiff reported the assaults to the NYPD and FBI, but authorities ignored her complaints, leading her to also contact Vanity Fair magazine, which was allegedly intimidated by Epstein into not publishing her story.
The civil complaint was filed under New York's Child Victims Act, citing the termination of a related criminal action against Epstein on August 29, 2019.
